summary: This is a memorandum documenting a voluntary interview conducted by the DOJ Office of the Inspector General with BOP Material Handler Specialist Michael Thomas regarding the death of inmate Jeffrey Epstein at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) New York on August 10, 2019. The interview was part of an official OIG investigation and was conducted with Thomas's legal and union representatives present.

keyFacts: The DOJ Office of the Inspector General conducted an official investigation into the death of BOP inmate Jeffrey Epstein.
Michael Thomas, a BOP Material Handler Specialist assigned to the MCC New York Special Housing Unit, was interviewed on June 17, 2021, regarding events on August 10, 2019.
Epstein (Register Number 76318-054) was found unresponsive in his cell at MCC New York on August 10, 2019.
The interview was voluntary, recorded, and conducted with Thomas's legal counsel (Montel Figgins) and a BOP union representative present.
The memorandum lists 17 attachments, including interview transcripts, training records, assignment rosters, count documentation, and pictures of Epstein's cell.
